required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Tremelimumab in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Multi-Center, Open-Label Study of Tremelimumab Monotherapy in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase II, Multi-Center, Open-Label Study of Tremelimumab Monotherapy in Patients with Advanced Solid Tumors

detailed_description.textblock: This is an open-label, multi-center study to determine the efficacy and safety of tremelimumab in the treatment of different cohorts of patients with selected advanced solid tumors. If eligible and at the discretion of the Investigator, after confirmed disease progression on tremelimumab monotherapy or during follow-up, patients will have the option of being sequenced to MEDI4736 (MedImmune 4736) monotherapy or MEDI4736 + tremelimumab combination therapy, for up to 12 months or until disease progression, whichever comes sooner.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Confirmed Overall Response During Tremelimumab Monotherapy Phase
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 12 months in the tremelimumab monotherapy phase
primary_outcome.description: Objective response rate (ORR) during the initial tremelimumab monotherapy phase was assessed by the site Investigator using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors, Version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1) and was defined as the percentage of patients with a confirmed overall response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) and was based on all treated patients who had measurable disease at baseline (Day 1). 95% confidence intervals (CIs) were calculated using the Clopper Pearson method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Duration of Response (DoR) During Tremelimumab Monotherapy Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 12 months in the tremelimumab monotherapy phase
secondary_outcome.description: DoR during the initial tremelimumab monotherapy phase was assessed by the site Investigator using RECIST 1.1 and was defined as the time from the date of first documented response until the first date of documented progression or death in the absence of disease progression. The time of the initial response was defined as the latest of the dates contributing toward the first visit response of CR or PR. If a patient did not progress following a response, then their DoR was censored at the progression-free survival (PFS) censoring time. DoR was not defined for those patients who did not have documented response. Median DoR was calculated using the Kaplan-Meier technique.

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Control Rate (DCR) During Tremelimumab Monotherapy Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 12 months in the tremelimumab monotherapy phase
secondary_outcome.description: DCR during the initial tremelimumab monotherapy phase was defined as the percentage of patients who had a best objective response (BoR) of CR or PR in the first 3 months (PDAC patients) or 4 months (UBC and TNBC patients) and 12 months (all patients), or who had demonstrated stable disease (SD) for a minimum interval of 3, 4 or 12 months following the start of study treatment. DCR was determined programmatically based on RECIST 1.1 using site Investigator data and all data up until the first progression event. 95% CIs were calculated using the Clopper Pearson method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median PFS During Tremelimumab Monotherapy Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 12 months in the tremelimumab monotherapy phase
secondary_outcome.description: PFS during the initial tremelimumab monotherapy phase was assessed by the site Investigator using RECIST 1.1 and was defined as the time from the date of enrollment until the date of objective disease progression or death (by any cause in the absence of progression), regardless of whether the patient withdrew from therapy or received another anticancer therapy prior to progression. Progression events that did not occur within 3 months (PDAC patients) or 4 months (UBC/TNBC patients) of the last evaluable assessment (or first dose) were censored. Median PFS was calculated using the Kaplan-Meier technique.

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Objective Response (BoR) During Tremelimumab Monotherapy Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 12 months in the tremelimumab monotherapy phase
secondary_outcome.description: BoR during the initial tremelimumab monotherapy phase was calculated based on the overall visit responses from each RECIST 1.1 assessment and was defined as the best response a patient had during their time in the study (from CR, PR, SD, PD or not evaluable [NE]) obtained among all tumor assessment visits from baseline until end of treatment or determination of PD. The BoR was summarized by percentage of patients for each category (CR, PR, SD, PD, and NE).

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Overall Survival (OS) During Tremelimumab Monotherapy Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to final data cut-off date
secondary_outcome.description: OS was defined as the time from the date of first dose until death due to any cause. Any patient not known to have died at the time of analysis was censored based on the last recorded date on which the patient was known to be alive. OS is presented from start of tremelimumab monotherapy phase and includes the retreatment phase if the patient entered the corresponding treatment phase. Median OS was calculated using the Kaplan-Meier technique.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Confirmed Overall Response During Retreatment Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 12 months in retreatment phase
secondary_outcome.description: ORR was assessed by the site Investigator using RECIST 1.1 and was defined as the percentage of patients with a confirmed overall response of CR or PR and was based on all treated patients who had measurable disease at baseline (Day 1) and who sequenced to durvalumab monotherapy (MEDI treatment phase) or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (COMBO treatment phase). 95% CIs were calculated using the Clopper Pearson method.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 12 months in retreatment phase
secondary_outcome.description: DoR during the retreatment phase was assessed by the site Investigator using RECIST 1.1 and was defined as the time from the date of first documented response until the first date of documented progression or death in the absence of disease progression. The time of the initial response was defined as the latest of the dates contributing toward the first visit response of CR or PR. If a patient did not progress following a response, then their DoR was censored at the PFS censoring time. DoR was not defined for those patients who did not have documented response. Median DoR was calculated using the Kaplan-Meier technique.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 4 months in retreatment phase
secondary_outcome.description: DCR during the retreatment phase was defined as the percentage of patients who had a BoR of CR or PR in the first 3 months (PDAC patients) or 4 months (UBC and TNBC patients) or who had demonstrated SD for a minimum interval of 3 or 4 months following the start of study treatment. DCR was determined programmatically based on RECIST 1.1 using site Investigator data and all data up until the first progression event. 95% CIs were calculated using the Clopper Pearson method.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 12 months in retreatment phase
secondary_outcome.description: PFS during the retreatment phase was assessed by the site Investigator using RECIST 1.1 and defined as the time from the date of enrollment until the date of objective disease progression or death (by any cause in the absence of progression), regardless of whether the patient withdrew from therapy or received another anticancer therapy prior to progression. Progression events that did not occur within 3 months (PDAC patients) or 4 months (UBC/TNBC patients) of the last evaluable assessment (or first dose) were censored. Median PFS was calculated using the Kaplan-Meier technique.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 12 months in retreatment phase
secondary_outcome.description: BoR during the retreatment phase was calculated based on the overall visit responses from each RECIST 1.1 assessment and was defined as the best response a patient had during their time in the study (from CR, PR, SD, PD or NE) obtained among all tumor assessment visits from baseline until end of treatment or determination of PD. The BoR was summarized by percentage of patients for each category (CR, PR, SD, PD, and NE).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline in retreatment phase to final data cut-off date
secondary_outcome.description: OS during the retreatment phase was defined as the time from the date of first dose until death due to any cause. Any patient not known to have died at the time of analysis was censored based on the last recorded date on which the patient was known to be alive. Median OS was calculated using the Kaplan-Meier technique.

arm_group.arm_group_label: treme mono to be sequenced to MEDI4736 mono or combination
arm_group.description: tremelimumab monotherapy, with the option for eligible patients to be sequenced to MEDI4736 monotherapy or MEDI4736 + tremelimumab combination therapy after progressive disease (PD)

intervention.arm_group_label: treme mono to be sequenced to MEDI4736 mono or combination
treme mono to be sequenced to MEDI4736 mono or combination
treme mono to be sequenced to MEDI4736 mono or combination

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. histologically or cytologically documented solid tumor malignancies, including but not limited to 1 of the following: UBC, Metastatic PDAC, TNBC; Are intolerant, are ineligible for, or have refused treatment with standard first-line therapy; 2. At least 1 lesion, not previously irradiated, that can be accurately measured at baseline as ≥10 mm in the longest diameter (except lymph nodes, which must have short axis ≥15 mm) with computed tomography (CT) (preferred) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans and that is suitable for accurate repeated measurements.
Exclusion criteria:
1. Any concurrent chemotherapy, biologic, or hormonal therapy for cancer Treatment; 2. History of leptomeningeal carcinomatosis; 3. Active or prior documented autoimmune or inflammatory disorders; 4. Brain metastases or spinal cord compression unless asymptomatic or treated and stable off steroids and anti-convulsants for at least 14 days prior to study treatment start; 5. QT interval corrected for heart rate using Fridericia's formula (QTcF) ≥470 ms; 6. Known allergy or hypersensitivity to IP or any IP excipient

overall_official.affiliation: Anderson Cancer Center, the University of Texas

clinical_study.keyword: Urothelial bladder cancer, Triple-negative breast cancer, Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, Advanced Solid Tumors, Tremelimumab, MEDI4736, ORR

patient_data.ipd_description: Qualified researchers can request access to anonymized individual patient-level data from AstraZeneca group of companies sponsored clinical trials via the request portal. All request will be evaluated as per the AZ disclosure commitment: https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: AstraZeneca will meet or exceed data availability as per the commitments made to the EFPIA Pharma Data Sharing Principles. For details of our timelines, please rerefer to our disclosure commitment at: https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: When a request has been approved AstraZeneca will provide access to the de-identified individual patient-level data in an approved sponsored tool . Signed Data Sharing Agreement (non-negotiable contract for data accessors) must be in place before accessing requested information. Additionally, all users will need to accept the terms and conditions of the SAS MSE to gain access. For additional details, please review the Disclosure Statements at: https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 64 patients with select advanced solid tumors were treated in this phase II, open-label, multi-center study from November 2015. Primary data cut off date: 17 February 2018. Final data cut off date: 31 December 2018.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The patients were split into 3 different analysis cohorts based on their tumor types: urothelial bladder cancer (UBC), triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC).

group.title: UBC Cohort
group.description: Patients with UBC entered the initial tremelimumab monotherapy phase and were administered tremelimumab via intravenous (IV) infusion at a dose of 750 milligrams (mg) once every 4 weeks (q4w) for 7 doses (cycles), then every 12 weeks (q12w) for 2 additional cycles, for up to a total of 12 months or until confirmed progressive disease (PD). Eligible patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were given the option for retreatment with tremelimumab monotherapy or to be sequenced to receive MEDI4736 (durvalumab) + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months or to receive durvalumab monotherapy (also referred to as MEDI; 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 12 months.

group.title: TNBC Cohort
group.description: Patients with TNBC entered the initial tremelimumab monotherapy phase and were administered tremelimumab via IV infusion at a dose of 750 mg q4w for 7 cycles, then q12w for 2 additional cycles, for up to a total of 12 months or until confirmed PD. Eligible patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were given the option for retreatment with tremelimumab monotherapy or to be sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months or to receive durvalumab monotherapy (also referred to as MEDI; 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 12 months.

group.title: PDAC Cohort
group.description: Patients with PDAC entered the initial tremelimumab monotherapy phase and were administered tremelimumab via IV infusion at a dose of 750 mg q4w for 7 cycles, then q12w for 2 additional cycles, for up to a total of 12 months or until confirmed PD. Eligible patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were given the option for retreatment with tremelimumab monotherapy or to be sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months or to receive durvalumab monotherapy (also referred to as MEDI; 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 12 months.

baseline.population: Analysis was performed on the FAS (all treated patients who received at least 1 dose of tremelimumab monotherapy).

measurement_list.measurement: Upper limit was not estimable in this cohort.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With Confirmed Overall Response During Retreatment Phase
outcome.description: ORR was assessed by the site Investigator using RECIST 1.1 and was defined as the percentage of patients with a confirmed overall response of CR or PR and was based on all treated patients who had measurable disease at baseline (Day 1) and who sequenced to durvalumab monotherapy (MEDI treatment phase) or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (COMBO treatment phase). 95% CIs were calculated using the Clopper Pearson method.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 12 months in retreatment phase
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the MEDI and COMBO analysis sets (all patients who were treated with tremelimumab, received at least 1 dose of durvalumab monotherapy or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy as applicable, and who had a baseline tumor assessment prior to dosing).

group.title: UBC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible UBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.title: TNBC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible TNBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.title: PDAC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible PDAC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.title: UBC- MEDI
group.description: Eligible UBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab monotherapy (also referred to as MEDI; 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 12 months.

group.title: PDAC - MEDI
group.description: Eligible PDAC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab monotherapy (also referred to as MEDI; 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 12 months.

measure.title: Percentage of Patients With Confirmed Overall Response During Retreatment Phase
measure.description: ORR was assessed by the site Investigator using RECIST 1.1 and was defined as the percentage of patients with a confirmed overall response of CR or PR and was based on all treated patients who had measurable disease at baseline (Day 1) and who sequenced to durvalumab monotherapy (MEDI treatment phase) or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (COMBO treatment phase). 95% CIs were calculated using the Clopper Pearson method.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the MEDI and COMBO analysis sets (all patients who were treated with tremelimumab, received at least 1 dose of durvalumab monotherapy or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy as applicable, and who had a baseline tumor assessment prior to dosing).

outcome.title: Median DoR During Retreatment Phase
outcome.description: DoR during the retreatment phase was assessed by the site Investigator using RECIST 1.1 and was defined as the time from the date of first documented response until the first date of documented progression or death in the absence of disease progression. The time of the initial response was defined as the latest of the dates contributing toward the first visit response of CR or PR. If a patient did not progress following a response, then their DoR was censored at the PFS censoring time. DoR was not defined for those patients who did not have documented response. Median DoR was calculated using the Kaplan-Meier technique.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 12 months in retreatment phase
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the MEDI and COMBO analysis sets (all patients who were treated with tremelimumab, received at least 1 dose of durvalumab monotherapy or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy as applicable, and who had a baseline tumor assessment prior to dosing).

group.description: Eligible PDAC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab monotherapy (also referred to as MEDI; 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 12 months.

measure.title: Median DoR During Retreatment Phase
measure.description: DoR during the retreatment phase was assessed by the site Investigator using RECIST 1.1 and was defined as the time from the date of first documented response until the first date of documented progression or death in the absence of disease progression. The time of the initial response was defined as the latest of the dates contributing toward the first visit response of CR or PR. If a patient did not progress following a response, then their DoR was censored at the PFS censoring time. DoR was not defined for those patients who did not have documented response. Median DoR was calculated using the Kaplan-Meier technique.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the MEDI and COMBO analysis sets (all patients who were treated with tremelimumab, received at least 1 dose of durvalumab monotherapy or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy as applicable, and who had a baseline tumor assessment prior to dosing).

DoR was not estimable in this cohort

outcome.title: DCR During Retreatment Phase
outcome.description: DCR during the retreatment phase was defined as the percentage of patients who had a BoR of CR or PR in the first 3 months (PDAC patients) or 4 months (UBC and TNBC patients) or who had demonstrated SD for a minimum interval of 3 or 4 months following the start of study treatment. DCR was determined programmatically based on RECIST 1.1 using site Investigator data and all data up until the first progression event. 95% CIs were calculated using the Clopper Pearson method.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 4 months in retreatment phase
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the MEDI and COMBO analysis sets (all patients who were treated with tremelimumab, received at least 1 dose of durvalumab monotherapy or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy as applicable, and who had a baseline tumor assessment prior to dosing).

group.title: UBC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible UBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.title: TNBC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible TNBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.title: PDAC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible PDAC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.title: UBC- MEDI
group.description: Eligible UBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab monotherapy (also referred to as MEDI; 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 12 months.

group.title: PDAC - MEDI
group.description: Eligible PDAC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab monotherapy (also referred to as MEDI; 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 12 months.

measure.title: DCR During Retreatment Phase
measure.description: DCR during the retreatment phase was defined as the percentage of patients who had a BoR of CR or PR in the first 3 months (PDAC patients) or 4 months (UBC and TNBC patients) or who had demonstrated SD for a minimum interval of 3 or 4 months following the start of study treatment. DCR was determined programmatically based on RECIST 1.1 using site Investigator data and all data up until the first progression event. 95% CIs were calculated using the Clopper Pearson method.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the MEDI and COMBO analysis sets (all patients who were treated with tremelimumab, received at least 1 dose of durvalumab monotherapy or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy as applicable, and who had a baseline tumor assessment prior to dosing).

outcome.title: Median PFS During Retreatment Phase
outcome.description: PFS during the retreatment phase was assessed by the site Investigator using RECIST 1.1 and defined as the time from the date of enrollment until the date of objective disease progression or death (by any cause in the absence of progression), regardless of whether the patient withdrew from therapy or received another anticancer therapy prior to progression. Progression events that did not occur within 3 months (PDAC patients) or 4 months (UBC/TNBC patients) of the last evaluable assessment (or first dose) were censored. Median PFS was calculated using the Kaplan-Meier technique.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 12 months in retreatment phase
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the MEDI and COMBO analysis sets (all patients who were treated with tremelimumab, received at least 1 dose of durvalumab monotherapy or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy as applicable, and who had a baseline tumor assessment prior to dosing).

group.title: UBC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible UBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.title: TNBC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible TNBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.title: PDAC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible PDAC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.description: Eligible UBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab monotherapy (also referred to as MEDI; 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 12 months.

group.title: PDAC - MEDI
group.description: Eligible PDAC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab monotherapy (also referred to as MEDI; 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 12 months.

measure.title: Median PFS During Retreatment Phase
measure.description: PFS during the retreatment phase was assessed by the site Investigator using RECIST 1.1 and defined as the time from the date of enrollment until the date of objective disease progression or death (by any cause in the absence of progression), regardless of whether the patient withdrew from therapy or received another anticancer therapy prior to progression. Progression events that did not occur within 3 months (PDAC patients) or 4 months (UBC/TNBC patients) of the last evaluable assessment (or first dose) were censored. Median PFS was calculated using the Kaplan-Meier technique.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the MEDI and COMBO analysis sets (all patients who were treated with tremelimumab, received at least 1 dose of durvalumab monotherapy or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy as applicable, and who had a baseline tumor assessment prior to dosing).

measurement_list.measurement: Upper limit was not estimable in this cohort.

outcome.title: BoR During Retreatment Phase
outcome.description: BoR during the retreatment phase was calculated based on the overall visit responses from each RECIST 1.1 assessment and was defined as the best response a patient had during their time in the study (from CR, PR, SD, PD or NE) obtained among all tumor assessment visits from baseline until end of treatment or determination of PD. The BoR was summarized by percentage of patients for each category (CR, PR, SD, PD, and NE).
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 12 months in retreatment phase
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the MEDI and COMBO analysis sets (all patients who were treated with tremelimumab, received at least 1 dose of durvalumab monotherapy or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy as applicable, and who had a baseline tumor assessment prior to dosing).

group.title: UBC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible UBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.title: TNBC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible TNBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.title: PDAC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible PDAC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.title: UBC- MEDI
group.description: Eligible UBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab monotherapy (also referred to as MEDI; 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 12 months.

group.title: PDAC - MEDI
group.description: Eligible PDAC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab monotherapy (also referred to as MEDI; 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 12 months.

measure.title: BoR During Retreatment Phase
measure.description: BoR during the retreatment phase was calculated based on the overall visit responses from each RECIST 1.1 assessment and was defined as the best response a patient had during their time in the study (from CR, PR, SD, PD or NE) obtained among all tumor assessment visits from baseline until end of treatment or determination of PD. The BoR was summarized by percentage of patients for each category (CR, PR, SD, PD, and NE).
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the MEDI and COMBO analysis sets (all patients who were treated with tremelimumab, received at least 1 dose of durvalumab monotherapy or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy as applicable, and who had a baseline tumor assessment prior to dosing).

outcome.title: Median OS During Retreatment Phase
outcome.description: OS during the retreatment phase was defined as the time from the date of first dose until death due to any cause. Any patient not known to have died at the time of analysis was censored based on the last recorded date on which the patient was known to be alive. Median OS was calculated using the Kaplan-Meier technique.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline in retreatment phase to final data cut-off date
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the MEDI and COMBO analysis sets (all patients who were treated with tremelimumab, received at least 1 dose of durvalumab monotherapy or durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy as applicable, and who had a baseline tumor assessment prior to dosing).

group.title: UBC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible UBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.title: TNBC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible TNBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

measure.description: OS during the retreatment phase was defined as the time from the date of first dose until death due to any cause. Any patient not known to have died at the time of analysis was censored based on the last recorded date on which the patient was known to be alive. Median OS was calculated using the Kaplan-Meier technique.

Lower and upper limits were not estimable in this cohort.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from Day 1 (i.e. first dose) up until 90 days following the end of treatment in the tremelimumab monotherapy phase and the retreatment phase (up to a total of 15 months per treatment phase).

group.title: UBC- Tremelimumab Monotherapy
group.description: Patients with UBC were administered tremelimumab via IV infusion at a dose of 750 mg q4w for 7 cycles, then q12w for 2 additional cycles, for up to a total of 12 months or until confirmed PD.

group.title: TNBC - Tremelimumab Monotherapy
group.description: Patients with TNBC were administered tremelimumab via IV infusion at a dose of 750 mg q4w for 7 cycles, then q12w for 2 additional cycles, for up to a total of 12 months or until confirmed PD.

group.title: PDAC- Tremelimumab Monotherapy
group.description: Patients with PDAC were administered tremelimumab via IV infusion at a dose of 750 mg q4w for 7 cycles, then q12w for 2 additional cycles, for up to a total of 12 months or until confirmed PD.

group.title: UBC - COMBO
group.description: Eligible UBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.description: Eligible TNBC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab + tremelimumab combination therapy (also referred to as COMBO; durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w in combination with tremelimumab 75 mg via IV infusion q4w for up to 4 cycles each, followed by durvalumab 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 8 months.

group.title: PDAC - MEDI
group.description: Eligible PDAC patients with confirmed PD on tremelimumab monotherapy or during the follow-up period were sequenced to receive durvalumab monotherapy (also referred to as MEDI; 1.5 g via IV infusion q4w) for up to a total of 12 months.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Publication of any or all of the results of the Research by the PI requires prior written consent of the Sponsor.
